1.title: Smelly Shotgun House To Chic Downtown Home
1.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

2.title: Saddest Home on Sanders Street
2.plot: Mina and Karen purchase a crumbling house in the Bates-Hendricks neighborhood, only to find out it's the first house they can't save. With a clean slate, Mina designs a white beauty with new buyers already in mind.

3.title: The Shabbiest Townhouse
3.plot: Mina and Karen fix up an outdated and bland townhouse in the heart of the Bates-Hendricks neighborhood for some friends of the family.

4.title: Outdated Townhome Gets a Funky Facelift
4.plot: Mina and Karen purchase and an old townhome and encounter several roadblocks that put a giant dent in their budget and their attitudes. But a "treasure" found in the ceiling might make them change their tune about this townhome.

5.title: Starting from Scratch in the Southside Neighborhood
5.plot: Mina and Karen redevelop a house that was hit by a car in the Old Southside neighborhood. After some fun demo with a giant water hose, they design their new house with a simple, urban and classic aesthetic.

6.title: The Half Million Dollar House
6.plot: Mina and Karen have purchased their most expensive house to date, in the most desirable neighborhood. They design a new layout that includes an extra loft space on the second floor and vaulted ceilings in the kitchen.

7.title: Empty Lot to Home Sweet Home
7.plot: After finding some surprising items buried under the empty lot they've purchased, Mina and Karen start construction on a four-bedroom home with an open floor plan and a bonus living space on the second floor.

8.title: The Little Brick House
8.plot: Mina and Karen tackle their first renovation of a brick house in a new neighborhood, giving it a rustic, schoolhouse style. They open up the living, dining and kitchen areas and fit in 3.5 bedrooms and 2.5 bathrooms.

9.title: A Backyard Barn for Karen
9.plot: Karen and Mina are tackling a special project, Karen's new barn-shaped guesthouse, which will have a garage on the first floor and guest space on the second floor. But before construction begins, they get bad news from the city.

10.title: Risky Reno with Historic Charm
10.plot: Despite its odd layout and decrepit state, Mina and Karen take on an old house with historic charm. A major structural problem hits the budget hard, and Mina gets some bad news that could threaten a huge selling point.

11.title: A Stately Home Full of Slithering Surprises
11.plot: Karen and Mina team up with their friend Josh on a renovation in Fountain Square. But during their initial walk-through, they find some of the previous owner's pet snakes still slithering throughout the house.

12.title: Poltergeist Property
12.plot: Mina and Karen take on a massive house in the Old Southside neighborhood, but their renovations are halted when they hear unexplained noises in the attic, discover a collapsing floor and uncover live termites.

13.title: Budget-Busting Victorian
13.plot: Mina and Karen purchase a home near the Northside neighborhood that's full of historical features. They do their best to preserve as many elements as possible, but structural slow-downs threaten their schedule and budget.

1.title: Tiny House, Huge Transformation
1.plot: Mina and Karen bought a 512-square-foot Victorian house in their neighborhood. They want to transform this tiny house into something bigger and better for its next owners.

2.title: An Old Victorian House Gets a New Facelift
2.plot: Mina and Karen nearly break the budget to buy a 2,100-square-foot Victorian house they discover is well worth saving.

3.title: Tiny House Turns Into a Bohemian Bungalow
3.plot: Mina and Karen have taken a chance and are renovating a 950-square-foot house. Will issues like an unsteady structure mean they can't make their money back on this risky venture?

4.title: A Neighborhood Eyesore That's a Horrible Before Becomes an Amazing After
4.plot: After purchasing a house from the city for only $4,000, Mina and Karen become worried they may have bitten off more than they can chew. Can they turn this abandoned dump into a neighborhood treasure?

5.title: Making Space in the Suburbs for a Large Family
5.plot: Mina and Karen renovate a cramped house for a big family in the suburbs.

6.title: An Old House Attracts New Neighbors
6.plot: Karen is caught off guard when Mina tells her that she purchased their next project for a high price. The rundown house is next door and not even a near disaster on demo day will keep the duo from creating a beautiful space.

7.title: Family Reunion Renovation
7.plot: Mina has mixed feelings when she agrees to remodel her dad's house in the suburbs of Indianapolis. Her childhood home definitely needs an update, but her father may still need some convincing.

8.title: A Structure Worth Saving
8.plot: Mina and Karen buy an abandoned house for a bargain price only to realize they will need to strip the house down to the studs to bring this neighborhood eyesore back to life.

9.title: Duplex Remodel Is Double the Trouble
9.plot: Karen and Mina are challenged to turn a duplex into a single-family house. If they can finish on time and budget, the results are sure to be twice as nice.

10.title: New Clients in the Countryside
10.plot: Mina and Karen travel out of downtown Indianapolis and into the countryside to do a home renovation. The Angles family feels their house is very closed-off and they want help opening it up.

11.title: Mom and Daughter Duo Renovate Neighborhoods One House at a Time
11.plot: Mina and Karen have renovated close to twenty homes in their community near downtown Indianapolis. Now they're venturing into the adjacent Bates Hendricks community. Have they taken on more than they bargained for?

1.title: Decaying Duplex Gets a Transformation
1.plot: Mina and Karen snag a 4-bedroom, 2-bathroom duplex for only $4,000. But with one of the worst foundations they've ever seen, Mina expects to spend upwards of $200,000 on the renovation.

2.title: Abandoned Partially Built Home Gets Rescued
2.plot: Mina and Karen see amazing possibilities for an abandoned new build in an up-and-coming neighborhood. Will the girls be able to pull off a successful renovation after issues arise and the trim carpenters quit mid-job?

3.title: An Office Becomes a Home
3.plot: Mina and Karen purchase a former office space in a transitional Indianapolis neighborhood. While the girls fully utilize the blank canvas, they soon realize they may have gone too far in that neighborhood and too far over budget.

4.title: Little White House on a Hill
4.plot: Mina and Karen buy a little white house on a hill with the potential to be a real charmer. The home has a great floor plan but also has serious foundation issues. Will the former owner be impressed with their transformation?

5.title: Flooded Two-Story Restored
5.plot: Mina and Karen discover piles of clothes, two toilets and two feet of water in the basement of their new duplex. They hope all the hard work in this decrepit home pays off with a buyer.

6.title: Big House, Big Potential
6.plot: Mina and Karen work on a house on Sanders Street, a huge project with age-related issues, including rotten wood, antiquated windows and many hidden treasures.

7.title: Facelift for a Tiny Victorian
7.plot: Mina and Karen give a full facelift to a rundown Victorian-style home with a funky layout in the Fountain Square community of Indianapolis.

8.title: Client Renovation Rescue
8.plot: Mina and Karen take on the half-finished renovation of a historic duplex. It's an easy profit if done right, but challenges with the preservation commission and a possible voodoo curse threaten to slow things down.

9.title: Eyesore Overhaul
9.plot: Mina and Karen are back in the Bates-Hendricks neighborhood with a brand-new project. They strip down a massive eyesore of a house with a confusing labyrinth on the inside and give it a charming new floor plan.

10.title: Beautifying a Boring Boxy Home
10.plot: Mina has second thoughts about a charmless, boxy house bought from the city for only $4,000. But Karen sees the potential and convinces Mina that they can transform the "giant cube" into an adorable single family home.

11.title: Small House, Big Problems
11.plot: Mina and Karen buy a tiny home for next to nothing and then wonder if it's worth all the challenges, which include holes in the roof and floor and a rotting foundation supported by nothing more than a dirt pile and a car jack.

12.title: Bugging Out on Budget
12.plot: Mina and Karen reach outside of their comfort zone as they renovate a cockroach-infested house on the edge of town.

13.title: Historical Hot Mess
13.plot: Mina and Karen splurge on a corner lot home in the historical neighborhood of Fletcher Place that can turn into a big payday if they can overcome the serious obstacles.

imdb.title: Good Bones
plot: Mom & daughter flipping abandoned houses in Indianapolis.::macntosh_12872
